Base.Explanation: Get the value of an attribute of an Active Directory object, for instance a user account. The attribute is specified by the LDAP display name of the attribute. For the most common properties, the LDAP name can be selected from a list.

ArrayElement.Name: User Object
ArrayElement.Description: A data structure representing a user account. If you want to obtain the property of a user account object, you can use this property to specify the Active Directory object for this action. Use the action 'Get user (AD)' to find the user account in Active Directory and setup the variable that contains the 'User Object'.

ArrayElement.Name: Active Directory Object
ArrayElement.Description: A data structure representing a Active Directory object for which an attribute must obtained. This property can only be used as a input variable. Earlier in the script, another script action must have generated the value for this variable.

ArrayElement.Name: LDAP attribute display name
ArrayElement.Description: The LDAP name of the attribute. The name identifies the attribute of the Active Directory object. For a number of well-known attributes, the LDAP name can be selected from a list but you can specify any other valid name.

ArrayElement.Name: Multi-value flag
ArrayElement.Description: Save multi-values as multi-values for the attribute. If set to 'Yes' and the attribute is multi-valued, the values are stored as multi-values (text list or table). If set to 'No' and the attribute is multi-valued, the values are converted into a single value. Default value: 'No'.

ArrayElement.Name: Convert to text flag
ArrayElement.Description: Convert the value(s) of the attribute to text. Default value: 'Yes'. If set, depending on property 'Multi-value flag', the result is either a single text or text list. If not set ('No'), the results is stored as one of the UMRA supported data types.

ArrayElement.Name: Error if no attribute found
ArrayElement.Description: Generate an error for this script action if the specified attribute is not found.

ArrayElement.Name: Error if empty
ArrayElement.Description: Generate an error for this script action if the attribute is found but attribute value is empty.

ArrayElement.Name: Attribute value
ArrayElement.Description: The value found for the attribute. This property is an 'output only' property and is generated by the application automatically. By default, the value for this property is stored in variable %AttributeValue%.

Base.Explanation: Create a directory on a remote or local computer. The directory can be the 'Home' or 'Profile' directory of a user account or any other directory that must be created. Optionally, you can specify directory permissions and share the directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Computer
ArrayElement.Description: The name of the computer (example: SERVER_A) on which the directory must be created. Together with the 'Parent Path' property this property defines the parent directory of the directory that must be created.

ArrayElement.Name: Parent Path
ArrayElement.Description: The path of the parent directory on the specified computer. The parent directory is the directory in which the new directory is to be created. The 'Parent Path' can be specified as a share name (example: USERDATA) or as a logical path (example: G:\Users) of the specified computer. In the latter case, an administrative share (example: G$) is used to access the parent directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Directory name
ArrayElement.Description: The name of the new directory (example: 'John'). The name of the directory is the last part of the full path of the directory. In case the home directory for a user account is specified, the name often equals the name of the user account (%UserName%).

ArrayElement.Name: Always create unique directory
ArrayElement.Description: If the directory already exists, the application can add a number to the directory name to make it unique (specify 'Yes'). If you specify 'No', no directory is created if the specified directory already exists.

ArrayElement.Name: Error if directory exists
ArrayElement.Description: If the directory already exists, the action fails and returns with an error. IF you have specified the option 'Always create unique directory' this situation cannot occur.

ArrayElement.Name: Security
ArrayElement.Description: The security settings of the new directory. The security settings include all of the permissions and the owner of the directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Share the directory
ArrayElement.Description: Once the directory is created, the directory can be shared by creating a share on the directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Share name
ArrayElement.Description: The name of the share that is used to create a share on the new directory. If a share with the same name already exists, a number is added to the share name until the share name is a unique name.

ArrayElement.Name: Share permissions
ArrayElement.Description: The permissions of the share (!) of the new directory. If this property is not specified, the default settings apply.

ArrayElement.Name: Share comment
ArrayElement.Description: A comment about the shared folder. The comment can contain any text and is an optional field.

ArrayElement.Name: Error if share exists
ArrayElement.Description: If the directory is shared (property 'Share the directory' set to 'Yes') and this property is set to 'Yes', an error is generated if the share already exists. If set to 'No', an incrementing number is added to the name of the share until it is unique.

ArrayElement.Name: Share user limit
ArrayElement.Description: Specifies the number of users who can connect to the shared folder at one time. If this property is not specified, the number is set to unlimited.

Base.Explanation: Setup the permissions (security access rights) of a directory, file or directory tree.

ArrayElement.Name: Target directory or file
ArrayElement.Description: The name of source directory or file. The source directory can be specified in two ways: For local directories: <logical drive>\<directory>\<directory> etc. Example: 'C:\UserData\Marketing'. For remote and local directories: \\<computer>\<share>\<directory>\<directory>. Example: '\\SERVER_A\Users\Data'. The source directory must exist. The name of the file or directory should not include any wildcard characters.

ArrayElement.Name: Security
ArrayElement.Description: The new security settings for the target directory and/or files. Note that the original security settings will be overwritten.

ArrayElement.Name: Propagation mode
ArrayElement.Description: Specify 'Yes' to setup the security settings for a typical user account home directory: The permission settings of the specified target directory are implicitly set to the specified value and then propagated to all child directories and subdirectories. Explicit security settings for child directories and files are removed.

ArrayElement.Name: Recursive mode
ArrayElement.Description: Specify 'Yes' to setup the security settings for the whole directory tree, including the specified directory, subdirectories and files, and subdirectories of subdirectories etc. For all directories and files of the directory tree, the security settings are set identically.

ArrayElement.Name: Use backup and restore privileges
ArrayElement.Description: A flag indicating that backup and restore privileges must be used to setup the security settings. This property is required in case the logged on user has no access rights to the directories and files that must be copied. The logged on user must have the corresponding access rights configured on the target computer to use these privileges successfully. See the online help for more information. Default value: 'No'.

ArrayElement.Name: Continue on error
ArrayElement.Description: A flag indicating that the action must continue with the next file or directory if an error occurs when setting the permissions of a file or directory. Default value: 'Yes'.
